main_definition: from this or that as a consequence or result; therefore.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To conclude something based on what has been said or done before. Example: 'The company was not doing well financially, hence they decided to downsize.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'Due to the heavy rains last night, the roads are flooded; hence traffic is expected to be slower this morning.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: From this point onwards or as a result of something previously mentioned. Example: 'The experiment was successful; hence we can move forward with further testing.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'She didn't enjoy the movie, hence she decided not to watch it again.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: Used to indicate a logical consequence or deduction. Example: 'He forgot his umbrella; hence he got wet in the rain.'
meanings_and_examples.example: 'She studied hard for the exam; hence she was able to answer all the questions correctly.'
